reuters.unknown: V E RM f reute u f BC OTTAWA WIDENS SALES T

text.title: OTTAWA WIDENS SALES TAX STUDIES REPLACEMENT
text.body: Canada broaden federal sales tax levied on manufacturers before scrapping system favor broad based multi staged sales tax finance minister Michael Wilson As expected Wilson did include new sales tax system as part his wide ranging tax reforms tabled House Commons today Instead federal government make interim changes to existing sales tax to make more fair low middle income Canadians The present sales tax fundamentally flawed hidden arbitrary capricious tax Wilson told House Commons existing federal sales tax system hurts Canadian economy by putting more tax on Canadian produced goods than imported goods adding hidden tax on Canadian exports makes them less competitive Wilson Interim changes effective January include applying federal sales tax to marketing companies related to manufacturers levying tax at wholesale level instead manufacturer selected range products applying pct sales tax to telecommunication services except residential telephone lines quicker collection federal sales taxes To offset these changes low income Canadians refundable tax credits be increased to dlrs dlrs adults to dlrs dlrs children finance department Ottawa considering three alternative forms new sales tax including goods services tax value added tax national sales tax combine existing federal provincial levies into one system Wilson told House Commons He federal government explore possibility one national sales tax Canada s provincial governments All provinces except Albeta now levy provincial sales tax varying amounts Wilson one joint system be simpler taxpayers maximize economic benefits tax reform If Ottawa provinces can t agree on national sales tax system Wilson federal government consider either goods services tax or value added tax goods services tax apply at one rate to virtually all goods services Canada include further increases refundable tax credits low middle income Canadians finance department documents accompanying Wilson s speech federal value added tax similar to European tax systems also be broad based but allow more flexibility to exempt selected goods services department finance deparment main drawback value added tax be more complex costly to implement than other two proposals

text.author: By Kathleen Hays Reuters
text.body: New U S Banking data suggest Federal Reserve guiding monetary policy along steady path signalling any imminent change course economists But they also if money supply growth remains weak as week s unexpected eight billion dlr M decline suggests may could influence Fed to loosen credit reins move toward more accommodative monetary policy survey money market economists produced forecast dlr M decline week ended June estimates ranging gain one billion dlrs to decline four billion Instead M fell eight billion dlrs to billion dlrs at seasonally adjusted annual rate Coming on heels billion decrease M week ended June means nation s money supply fallen more than billion dlrs past two weeks economists M hit air pocket weakness Bill Sullivan Dean Witter Reynolds Inc While M may lost significance as indicator economic growth Sullivan Fed officials might be concerned latest drop M means another month sluggish growth broader monetary aggregates M M seen as better gauges economic growth Latest monthly M M data showed as May both measures were growing at rates below bottom Fed s to pct target ranges If money growth does accelerate Fed officials concerned indicates economic growth flagging could turn toward easier monetary policy economists Does mean Fed abandons current open market position No Sullivan But does mean end tightening time being Definitely yes Economists average adjusted discount window borrowings dlrs latest two week bank statement period were lower than they expected Most believed Fed targetted two week borrowings average around dlrs But they if been large one day net miss Fed s reserve projections higher borrowings target probably been reached drop May U S Housing starts continued weakness auto sales show key sectors U S Economy lagging while recent modest pct gain May producer prices helped dispel inflation fears Slifer If continues we can entertain notion Fed easing at some point he Other economists Fed probably pay little attention to weak money supply growth It been number years since M given good signs what s going on economy one I don t think M shows economy falling apart Fed should ease Economists agreed stable dollar continue to be prerequisite any move by Fed toward easier monetary policy They Fed reluctant to lower short term rates fear spur expectations weaker dollar higher inflation push up long term yields choke off econmomic growth But Sullivan dollar been steady since late April The Fed to determine if represents fundamental change dollar If does then gives them more room to ease he

text.body: The conservative opposition already fighting uphill election battle now faces controversy own ranks over possible error major tax cutting program economists Professor Michael Porter architect tax plan declined to refute Treasurer Paul Keating s charge opposition miscalculated tax expenditure cuts by several billion dollars Economists opposition trailing behind Labour opinion polls find chances further diminished if tax policy miscalculation tax plan unveiled by opposition leader John Howard week cornerstone Liberal Party s economic strategy to oust Labour Party July poll Keating Howard tax plan sharply increase budget deficit to more than nine billion dlrs severely damage Australia s economy already overburdened balance payments foreign debt problems his mini budget on May Keating budget deficit year ending June be between two three billion dlrs Porter key member opposition economic think tank he played leading role formulating tax plan but Howard s proposed expenditure savings Keating claimed were distorted through double counting Some opposition members there appeared to be errors but Liberal Party spokesman refused comment saying package being reexamined The whole thing so deceitful Prime Minister Bob Hawke radio interview Howard made mess If they can t govern themselves how can they expect to govern country Hawke who seeking third term opposition made election one easiest him I ve never felt more physically mentally relaxed during election We ve no problems at all he latest public opinion poll published Melbourne Sun newspaper showed Labour leading opposition by points indicating seat majority Hawke parliament Election Commission announced night candidates contest seat House Representatives while candidates fight Senate seats

text.title: PHILIPPINE STOCKS SOAR TO NEW HIGHS RECORD VOLUME
text.author: By Greg Hutchinson Reuters
text.body: Investors on Philippine stock markets shrugged off growing communist activity cities to push share prices to all time highs on record turnover brokers Regularly heavy trading more than one billion shares day sent Manila exchange s composite index soaring to points just over three weeks Brokers described recent trading as frantic hectic as trading records were smashed day after day total billion shares worth million pesos changed hands on main Manila less important Makati exchanges yesterday much activity among centavo priced stocks brokers turnover more than double record billion shares worth million pesos set on Wednesday Brokers rising gold prices caused mining shares to shoot up three weeks ago other sectors followed Share prices continued their rise even when gold price fell back to dlrs ounce due to rising confidence President Corazon Aquino s handling economy they Brokers Aquino s handling year old communist insurgency maintenance relatively low interest rates also contributed to rise Blue chip stocks such as those San Miguel Corp Philippine Long Distance Telephone Co PLDT risen pct three weeks trend upward medium term although temporary correction overdue they Since surge began on May Manila s Mining index risen to points commercial industrial index shot up to points oils indicator increased to points Market activity been rising spurts since Ferdinand Marcos replaced by Aquino months ago One broker he thought Philippine stock market may at come age Wilson Sy president Prudential Securities local stockbroking firm Hong Kong affiliations told Reuters Barring any unforeseen political events you can bet on Philippine market shrugged off communist inroads into Manila Assassins killed policemen soldiers security guards capital year Communist hitmen known as sparrows claimed they killed them Sy Philippine stocks were undervalued world terms price earnings ratios often half those Hong Kong one sixth those Japan He PLDT also U S Listed price earnings ratio nine Sy predicted Manila s composite index rise beyond points current mark by year end Other brokers were more cautious saying Aquino to improve peace order before investors could treat Philippines as they Hong Kong or Tokyo One broker he believed pct money going into stocks now foreign much fund managers their agents based Hong Kong New York Manila Stock Exchange chairman Robert Coyuito told Reuters If peace order situation really improved market could move beyond price earnings ratio times But all depends on how Congress performs local elections go he new two chamber legislature elected month due to sit on July Local elections scheduled November PLDT shares closed at pesos share yesterday pesos above Wednesday s record close PLDT share prices risen nine fold months San Miguel shares closed at pesos also historic high brokers

reuters.unknown: RM AI f reute u f BC CANADIAN TAX REFORM C

text.title: CANADIAN TAX REFORM CALLED AN IMPORTANT STEP
text.author: By Larry Welsh Reuters
text.body: Canada s sweeping tax reform package announced today important step towards fairer system but as bold revamp tax structure as some expected economists business leaders It s biggest step towards tax reform we ve taken great many years Merrill Lynch Canada Inc chief economist Michael Manford told Reuters But system same old system lot important changes as opposed to brand new system he added See spotlight index page on ECRA Manford changes introduced by Finance Minister Michael Wilson did go far enough simplifying federal tax system They represent evolutionary rather than revolutionary reform Overall I thought more timid step than we were led to believe he Wilson s move to increase money collected corporations while cutting individual taxes is probably acceptable shift Bill James president Falconbridge Ltd international mining company Wilson spread corporate tax increases fairly evenly across corporate sector James So s going to hit anyone too hard we remain competitive Wilson his speech to House Commons Canada s tax system needed to be changed to compete sweeping reforms United States year The critical thing on corporate side Wilson moved most taxes much closer to U S System Manford federal government increased taxes paid by corporations by five billion dlrs over next five years but lowered personal taxes by billion dlrs same period Despite collecting more corporate taxes Wilson able to lower tax rate on individual companies by removing many special tax exemptions broadening tax base Wilson s plan also reduced capital cost allowance used by companies to write off major investments some business spokesmen hurt business long run That affect some investment decisions negatively Laurent Thiebeault Canadian Manufacturers Association president Tax analysts some industries take several days to assess impact capital cost allowance reductions be made over number years As anticipated Canada s opposition parties signalled they intend to fight new tax measures as they introduced Parliament over next few months It s tax reform s tax grab Liberal leader John Turner Turner labelled changes to federal sales tax a money machine minister finance Wilson broadened federal sales tax to include additional products also promised to introduce broad based multi staged sales tax It s at all fair package Canadians going to see very quickly New Democratic Party leader Ed Broadbent However economist Manford Wilson acted wisely to protect lower income Canadians by providing tax credits cut people tax rolls

than before our currency getting more stable He reserves mainly result trade surplus U S Rose at rate two to three billion U S Dlrs month between January May reserves world s third largest after Japan West Germany now total well over billion U S Dlrs On June central bank froze overseas borrowings local foreign banks cut limit on central bank purchases forward U S Dollars banks to pct pct value contract Local foreign bankers June measures drastically limited their ability to lend foreign exchange to importers exporters They their overseas borrowings forward dollar transactions showed drastic decline some banks registering fall up to pct Bank dealers Taiwan dollar stabilised against U S Currency week after rising two to five Taiwanese cents day between June compared rise five to eight cents May bank dealers central bank previously bought U S Dollars heavily sold at least billion U S Dlrs past two weeks to meet commercial demand They they expected government to keep local dollar stable near term to give breathing space to businesses experiencing slower exports because rise more than pct value Taiwan dollar since September Taiwan dollar opened at to U S Dollar today unchanged yesterday Keh Fei Lo vice president First Commercial Bank It appears central bank s move to curb capital inflow quite successful Vice economic minister Wang Chien Shien slower rise foreign exchange reserves help ease pressure Washington over large U S Trade deficit Taiwan Over past year Taiwanese businessmen delayed imports machinery production equipment because exchange rate uncertainty he stable exchange rate help boost imports particularly United States

reuters.unknown: F f reute u f BC JAPAN REPORT SAYS FAU

text.title: JAPAN REPORT SAYS FAULTY REPAIRS CAUSED JAL CRASH
text.body: Faulty repairs inadequate inspection caused crash Japan Airlines Co Ltd JAPN T JAL Boeing killed people Japanese government final official report clear cause crash faulty repair work by Boeing Co BA Shun Takeda ministry transport official leading accident investigation committee But report also criticised ministry s inspectors failing to carry out full check repairs before signing clearance sheet aircraft hit Mount Osutaka north Tokyo on August after bulkhead separating pressurised cabin unpressurised tail suddenly burst fracturing key navigation systems Only four people survived Japan Air Lines spokesman declined comment on report Boeing expected to release statement later today report cleared JAL crew all responsibility separate set recommendations investigators large aircraft operating Japan should fail safe systems but did say how should be done press statement by group lawyers representing victims crash criticised report dealing greater depth fail safe aspect lawyers Boeing showed believed crash due to design defects by specifying two design modifications to prevent recurrence memorandum filed King County Washington Superior Court March They similar official recommendations fail safe systems following two air disasters involving DC aircraft near Paris at Chicago been rejected after objections aircraft manufacturers government investigators asked ministry to formulate concrete guidelines inspectors internal ministry memo earlier year complained inspectors were left too much on their own when making aircraft checks Boeing team made repairs to aircraft s aft bulkhead under JAL supervision Transport Ministry inspectors approved repairs without actually seeing them today s report inspectors were unable to check Boeing s work because part repaired been covered by seal report Over time cabin pressurisation speeded up process metal fatigue repaired bulkhead Boeing issued official statement on September saying repairs carried out were faulty did link them crash

reuters.unknown: RM AI f reute u f BC U S SEEKS JAPAN HELP

text.title: U S SEEKS JAPAN HELP IN EVENT OF RECESSION
text.author: By Rich Miller Reuters
text.body: Senior U S Officials looking to Japan help buttressing world economy event American recession next year Japanese government sources During visit to U S Earlier month Economic Planning Minister Tetsuo Kondo asked by both U S Federal Reserve chairman Paul Volcker Council Economic Advisers chairman Beryl Sprinkel what Japan could do if U S Enters recession next year Although Sprinkel indicated he personally did expect recession next year Volcker seemed to acknowledge economic downturn at least possibility sources Faced huge budget deficit U S little room to manoeuvre on fiscal policy to counteract any downturn might occur also hamstrung as far as monetary policy concerned because U S Inflation already showing some signs picking up one source But Japan also limited what action could take to help counteract U S Recession without running risk overstimulating domestic economy pushing up inflation sources Money supply growth accelerating interest rates at record low levels May M money supply plus certificates deposit grew at year on year rate pct well above nominal GNP growth four to five pct Some government sources also worried recently announced billion yen emergency economic package could push up land prices construction sector s inflation Public investment spending grew at year on year rate pct April but could accelerate to pct later year under impact emergency package one source billion yen package generally well received U S Although U S Congressmen businessmen told Kondo they wanted measures implemented quickly sources Japanese minister explained acceleration public works spending package taking place immediately they U S Congressmen were particularly interested how much impact package on reducing bilateral trade imbalance question Kondo unable to answer clearly given many economic uncertainties involved sources While recognizing Japan s trade surplus falling terms volume some Congressmen expressed concern falling fast enough But sources no one pressed Kondo further rise yen as solution to correcting bilateral trade imbalance

reuters.unknown: E f reute d f BC CANADIAN TAX REFORM C

text.title: CANADIAN TAX REFORM CALLED AN IMPORTANT STEP
text.author: By Larry Welsh Reuters
text.body: Canada s sweeping tax reform package announced today important step towards fairer system but as bold revamp tax structure as some expected economists business leaders It s biggest step towards tax reform we ve taken great many years Merrill Lynch Canada Inc chief economist Michael Manford told Reuters But system same old system lot important changes as opposed to brand new system he added Manford changes introduced by Finance Minister Michael Wilson did go far enough simplifying federal tax system They represent evolutionary rather than revolutionary reform Overall I thought more timid step than we were led to believe he Wilson s move to increase money collected corporations while cutting individual taxes is probably acceptable shift Bill James president Falconbridge Ltd international mining company Wilson spread corporate tax increases fairly evenly across corporate sector James So s going to hit anyone too hard we remain competitive Wilson his speech to House Commons Canada s tax system needed to be changed to compete sweeping reforms United States year The critical thing on corporate side Wilson moved most taxes much closer to U S System Manford federal government increased taxes paid by corporations by five billion dlrs over next five years but lowered personal taxes by billion dlrs same period Despite collecting more corporate taxes Wilson able to lower tax rate on individual companies by removing many special tax exemptions broadening tax base Wilson s plan also reduced capital cost allowance used by companies to write off major investments some business spokesmen hurt business long run That affect some investment decisions negatively Laurent Thiebeault Canadian Manufacturers Association president Tax analysts some industries take several days to assess impact capital cost allowance reductions be made over number years As anticipated Canada s opposition parties signalled they intend to fight new tax measures as they introduced Parliament over next few months It s tax reform s tax grab Liberal leader John Turner Turner labelled changes to federal sales tax a money machine minister finance Wilson broadened federal sales tax to include additional products also promised to introduce broad based multi staged sales tax It s at all fair package Canadians going to see very quickly New Democratic Party leader Ed Broadbent However economist Manford Wilson acted wisely to protect lower income Canadians by providing tax credits cut people tax rolls

reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC U K LENDERS OFFER MO

text.title: U K LENDERS OFFER MORE FIXED RATE MORTGAGES
text.author: By Norma Cohen Reuters
text.body: More U K Lenders offering homebuyers fixed interest rate mortgages under borrower makes same monthly payment no matter what happens to other interest rates mortgage rates now at their lowest levels years loans been snapped up by eager home buyers trying to lock into cheap money decision to offer fixed rate loans industry officials reflects increasingly competitive nature home mortgage business While fixed rate mortgages uncommon U K They were mainstay business U S Up until only few years ago But early s interest rates soared U S Lenders mostly savings loan associations were earning rates as low as three pct on year fixed rate mortgages they held their portfolios but to pay depositors rates as high as pct to induce them to retain their accounts As result hundreds institutions collapsed or were forced to merge survivors decided to offer mortgages whose rates move line cost funds We very much example U S Thrifts mind spokesman Abbey National Building Society explaining why his institution time being only offering variable rate mortgages rash advertising to solicit new business helped homebuyers to become even choosier loans lenders concede they being forced to undercut each other still more Sharp cuts on variable rate mortgages announced earlier week by nation s two largest building societies by National Westminster Bank Plc reflect growing competition new business officials at all three institutions fixed rate mortgages on offer carry interest rates even below those on variable rate loans Of course they less profitable than other variable rate mortgages spokesman Midland Bank Plc earlier year earmarked dlrs fixed rate new mortgage loans But he bank willing to offer less profitable loans because It just another way to attract people to our mortgage product Trustee Savings Bank Plc TSB offering five year fixed rate mortgages at pct earlier year stg TSB set aside loans exhausted within just few days according to spokeswoman Everybody loves under pct mortgage she noting within five days bank loaned equivalent pct volume short appeal fixed rate mortgages they offer opportunity to gamble on direction interest rates If interest rates fall after mortgage made lender earning above average return on assets But if interest rates rise homebuyer who won benefit cheap money Household Mortgage Co planned to offer year fixed rate mortgage after June elections on assumption Conservative Party victory help money market rates fall further according to Duncan Young managing director Young explained company planned to protect itself against chance rising interest rates by buying complicated hedging instrument But money market rates risen contrary to expectations company shelved plans time being He money market rates were too high to arrange both mortgages hedge profitably However he when Household Mortgage Co does make fixed rate mortgages likely to securitise them means bundling different mortgages together to resemble bond selling them to investor technical reasons securitisation simpler more efficient fixed rate rather than floating rate mortgages U S Where fixed rate mortgages popular again securitisation provided bulk mortgage money over past few years

reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC SPAIN PLANS TARIFF OV

text.title: SPAIN PLANS TARIFF OVERHAUL FOR POWER UTILITIES
text.author: By Andrew Hurst Reuters
text.body: Spain s socialist government aiming to restore confidence foreign banks power generation sector by pushing through complete reform industry s tariff structure senior government official Most foreign banks been refusing to extend fresh loans to mainly privately owned sector since Fuerzas Electricas de Catalunya S A FECSA major utility defaulted on two billion dlrs foreign currency debt earlier year Secretary State Economy Guillermo De la Dehesa told Reuters interview new government inspired tariff mechanism providing automatic increases each year guarantee long term viability industry He bill be sent before Spanish Cortes parliament summer enabling tariff increases next year to be set under new system De la Dehesa declined to give technical details scheme known here as Marco Estable stable framework but future tariff increases make up failure past adjustments to cover rising costs The utility companies captive market if they assured satisfactory tariff structure they best all possible worlds to do business De la Dehesa FECSA s debt crisis caused concern among foreign Spanish bankers who expressed fears other utility companies may default lack fresh funds unless confidence industry s future restored Spain s leading power utilities massive debts short medium term exposure billion pesetas at end year significant proportion foreign currency bankers say new tariff plan currently being discussed representatives utility industry Spanish bankers shortly be presented to foreign creditors De la Dehesa FECSA s problems were precipitated February when stock exchange suspended trading company s stock on grounds could meet debts FECSA special case De la Dehesa but banks took fright extended crisis to rest utility sector We really did expect Much foreign bank lending to utility sector been on strength government commitment made to international bankers at presentation London to support industry I think if foreign banks were lending on basis declarations by our energy authorities London they all more reason to do so when new tariff system passed into law De la Dehesa This going to be palpable fact just declaration he added De la Dehesa he believed once confidence restored sector as whole FECSA s debt problems be quickly solved recently formed steering committee representing FECSA s foreign creditors due to meet FECSA managers Barcelona on Tuesday round talks on rescheduling ailing utility s debt FECSA s General Manager Jose Zaforteza told Reuters he thought climate talks be greatly improved by new tariff proposals You cannot go far wrong when you managing electrical utility provided tariffs you charge sufficient to cover your costs Zaforteza General Manager Madrid branch U S Bank lent money to FECSA there be little significant text.title: U S OIL PRICES STRONG AHEAD OF OPEC MEETING
text.author: By SUSAN SHERER Reuters
text.body: U S crude oil prices at their highest level more than year ahead next week s OPEC meeting even though most industry analysts do expect any policy changes session They prices steadily climbed since organization s accord December risen on technical factors within market concerns supplies because Iran Iraq war could disrupt deliveries Gulf U S benchmark crude West Texas Intermediate trading around dlrs July contract on New York Mercantile Exchange s energy futures spot market highest level since January OPEC conference president Rilwanu Lukman who Nigeria s oil minister Friday he expects meeting Vienna to be brief calm OPEC s current price production agreement may only need slight review Although most industry experts expect just reaffirmation December agreement oil prices continue to climb due to desire to hedge positions case any surprises Analysts expect higher prices to continue until soon after OPEC meeting At point barring any increased tension Gulf or changes OPEC s policies prices should begin easing OPEC probably do anything hasn t already agreed to December because oil prices firm John Hill vice president at Merrill Lynch Futures OPEC agreed December to maintain official oil prices at dlrs barrel raise group s production ceiling to barrels per day third quarter to barrels fourth quarter agreement helped send prices sharply higher rising dlrs barrel early December Several OPEC members who price hawks including Iran Algeria Libya seek higher official price reduction output And if U S West Texas Intermediate crude continues to trade above dlrs barrel there greater chance OPEC raise official dlrs price Nauman Barakat analyst at Smith Barney Harris Upham Co But most analysts expect more moderate producers such as Saudi Arabia to block any changes policy The meeting be non event no change official prices because OPEC particular Saudis committed to stabilizing market Rosario Ilacqua analyst L F Rothschild However some analysts OPEC may need to hold meeting September to re evaluate market conditions Overproduction by OPEC become real problem fourth quarter when quota raised to barrels day Iraq s pipeline through Turkey brings another barrels to market each day John Lichtblau president Petroleum Industry Ressearch Foundation Most expect Saudi Arabia to oppose price increase at meeting but many look increase by year end to dlrs to offset decline dollar Oil prices denominated throughout world dollars so as currency declines producers receive less money their oil The only real production restraint OPEC Saudi Arabia Sanford Margoshes analyst at Shearson Lehman Brothers In second half year we expect Saudis to produce at their barrel day quota therefore act as vehicle to stablize market pave way two dlrs barrel price increase at December meeting he One uncertain factor course Iran Iraq war The wild card increased tensions Persian Gulf Frank Knuettel analyst Prudential Bache Securites Oil tankers taking oil Iraq Kuwait been regular targets Iranian planes Reagan administration planning to put Kuwait tankers under protection U S flag naval escorts Extra oil inventories needed during time crisis like just general nervousness over incident could disrupt oil supplies drives prices up Knuettel

reuters.unknown: F f reute r f BC FURTHER US DEFENSE WR

text.title: FURTHER US DEFENSE WRITEOFFS LIKELY ANALYSTS SAY
text.author: By Steven Radwell Reuters
text.body: The tug of war over who pays to develop new weapons contractors or government is likely to lead to more writeoffs by defense firms analysts Singer Co SMF Northrop Corp NOC recently announced planned second quarter writeoffs related to costs major defense programs under fixed price government contracts It s case companies paying things different environment Defense Department paid Howard Mager Donaldson Lufkin Jenrette Securities Corp recent years Defense Department DOD increased competitive bidding weapons contracts asked contractors to pay more costs developing weapons programs moves helped cut waste abuse by contractors but also dictated firms assume much more risk analysts It s stricter environment Anthony Hatch Argus Research Corp Contractors absorbing more cost more risk s likely to be trend some time to come trend probably lead to further writeoffs analysts Programs most prone they agreed Advanced Tactical Fighter ATF new generation high technology fighter plane being developed U S Air Force C air transport plane Light Helicopter Experimental LHX under development Army Other programs may also be affected they Air Force expected to order advanced fighter planes s at cost up to billion dlrs analysts Two teams contractors competing contract to develop prototype ATF Lockheed Corp LK General Dynamics Corp GD Boeing Co BA teamed competition against Northrop Corp NOC McDonnell Douglas Corp MD on ATF two teams fighting award to develop LHX Bell Helicopter unit Textron Inc TXT coupled McDonnell Douglas United Technologies Corp s UTX Sikorsky paired Boeing C four engine transport plane McDonnell Douglas s Douglas Aircraft Co working on two test planes production award up to aircraft should be made by late Douglas Aircraft spokesman Under government s new procedures contractors can spend hundreds millions dollars on development typically recoup their investments during production But now government sometimes awards production to second contractor who did develop system General Electric Co GE example developed F engine Navy But two weeks ago Pentagon awarded pct F production to United Technologies Pratt Whitney Such tactics increased competition but government now risks decimating industry by making too competitive Michael LaTronica Redding Research Group Two years ago defense contractors were their own worst enemies They were cost efficient LaTronica Now DOD allowed situation to swing so far back other way you may be danger losing defense industry as national resource While nation as whole posted trade deficits recent years aerospace defense exported more products than imported he noted LaTronica others however changes government procurement may be coming I hear Pentagon looking into situation John Diamantis defense analyst at Pershing Co He some small defense electronics firms believe Pentagon begin re evaluating procurement policy perhaps start paying more development money Redding Research s LaTronica who still likes industry despite probability additional unforeseen writeoffs There s been swing sentiment defense bashing psychology few years starting to shift LaTronica noted one government official recently suggested winner ATF prototype award should get sole production plane specified time investments large Lockheed General Dynamics Boeing ATF team example spending dlrs just to develop prototype danger Pentagon runs if changes made companies hesitate to bid to develop program but instead wait second source production award But may take company going bust to really change people s thinking LaTronica

text.author: By Samuel Fromartz Reuters
text.body: Merck Co MRK Squibb Corp SQB benefit study shows lower levels blood cholesterol slows build up fat heart s arteries lowering risk heart attacks industry analysts Both companies developed drugs slow body s production cholesterol although Merck months ahead Squibb drug expected to be approved year Certainly study create greater acceptance anti cholesterol drugs Robert Uhl drug analyst at F Eberstadt Fleming Although neither company s drug used study conducted by team scientists at University Southern California School Medicine both leaders new class drugs fight cholesterol study reported Journal American Medical Association showed lower levels cholesterol achieved through combination drugs special diet slowed some cases reversed build up fatty deposits heart s arteries Such build up leads to heart attacks leading cause death U S Health officials lower levels cholesterol could immediately benefit six Americans who suffer symptoms coronary artery disease study advocated reduction cholesterol some Americans As anti cholesterol crusade gains momentum industry analysts executives believe healthier diet drug therapy gain wider acceptance context pharmaceutical analyst David Crossen Sanford C Bernstein the culture can shift terms drug treatment because some people arn t going to fundamentally alter their diets worldwide anti cholesterol drug market valued at dlrs year But as new drugs reach market analysts estimate revenues swell to billion dlrs annually next five years drugs used study combination low cholesterol diet were niacin common compound colestipol drug Upjohn Co UPJ sold since But these two drugs some drawbacks analysts say new drugs Merck Squibb avoid Niacin leads to tremendous amounts flushing constipation or stomach upset Crossen Colestipol sand like powder comes dosage to grams must be mixed glass water It isn t fun to take Crossen Drug analyst Uhl drawbacks restricted Upjohn s sales drug he under dlrs year contrast new drugs Merck Squibb little side effects because they target key factor body s production cholesterol enzyme found liver Past methods getting down cholesterol been rather variable Dr Charles Sanders executive vice president at Squibb new drugs contrast interupt clear step cholesterol production Sanders Also new drugs easier to take since they come tablet form swallowed once or twice day Merck s drug Mevacor received recommendation advisory panel Food Drug Administration earlier year expected to receive full approval sale late summer or fall Squibb s drug eptastatin expected to be submitted regulatory approval first or second quarter Sanders Warner Lambert Co WLA Bristol Meyers Co BMY also cholesterol fighting compounds similar to Upjohn drug but only Merck Upjohn ahead new class cholesterol inhibitors

reuters.unknown: C T f reute u f BC EUROPEAN COFFEE TRADE

text.title: EUROPEAN COFFEE TRADE PROPOSES NEW QUOTA FORMULA
text.author: By Jeremy Lovell Reuters
text.body: European coffee roasters traders agreed to propose new formula calculating International Coffee Organization ICO quotas Dutch Coffee Trade Association chairman chairman Frits van Horick Van Horick who council member European Coffee Federation speaking at end ECF annual meeting new formula based on six year moving averages give Brazil world s biggest coffee producer unchanged quota remaining two years current coffee agreement van Horick If accepted by consumer producer members ICO formula could also be basis negotiating new agreement van Horick Coffee quotas were suspended February year when prices shot up on fears drought induced crop disaster Brazil Although prices now considerably lower consumers producers been unable to agree on re introduction Brazil been most strongly against any change formula because feared lower quota But our proposal leaves very little to object to van Horick The existing quota system far too rigid does reflect supply demand reality he Our formula builds flexibility into system benefit almost everyone Although full implications new formula still to be worked out initial estimates suggest countries such as Colombia Kenya Indonesia Costa Rica get slightly higher quotas while others such as Ivory Coast El Salvador Nicaragua lose quota share van Horick Because proposal provides future quota distribution must reflect current demand actual supply should also prevent under shipment quota as countries doing so automatically prejudice their following year s quota If ICO consumers accept our proposal stands at least fair chance being accepted by producers at September meeting most whom generally favour new quota formula van Horick At same time much depend on Brazil s attitude Brazil increasingly isolated on producer side If there no frost damage to coffee crop over next two months most other producers favour our proposal we might just get agreement van Horick added

reuters.unknown: RM A f reute r f BC LLOYDS BOND MARKET WI

text.title: LLOYDS BANK BOND MARKET WITHDRAWAL CALLED PRUDENT
text.author: By Marguerite Nugent Reuters
text.body: Lloyds Bank Plc s LLOY L decision to withdraw making markets Eurobonds U K Government bonds gilts sent shivers down spines other market participants but viewed as prudent by banking analysts It the move really isn t surprise They lost lot money early stages gilt market now they want to cut their losses while they can Keith Brown banking analyst at Greenwell Montagu The question now how many other gilt market makers face similar fate one senior gilt market maker Eurobond market participants were equally stunned They first firm size I can remember to pulled out eurobond market making altogether member Association International Bond Dealers London staff Other Eurobond market participants while Lloyds frequently changed staff some eurobond operations hard to believe they were trouble action Lloyds third largest U K clearing bank becomes first U K clearing bank to withdraw gilt market following Big Bang deregulation London Stock Exchange October Earlier year Midland Bank Plc MDBL L fourth largest clearing bank opted out making markets equities on grounds return did justify expense continues as market maker gilts however prepared statement Lloyds Bank chief executive Brian Pitman bank relatively small position these two overcrowded markets we decided to reallocate resources to opportunities promise better return on our shareholders investment Lloyds maintain presence short term securities trading swaps other treasury products Alan Moore Lloyds Treasurer told Reuters decision forward looking followed strategic review prospects Lloyds these markets We decided return just attractive he Although decision made at meeting Lloyds board morning Moore been under consideration some time He denied move reaction to events trading room although he acknowledged bank s gilt operations were profitable early stages new market Greenwell s Brown noted all Lloyds Merchant Bank sustained loss stg most he were accounted by Eurobond gilt operations all Lloyds reported pre tax profit stg Lloyds so big can easily absorb these losses Brown noting they minuscule when compared bank s exposure to Latin America U K Clearing banks come under pressure to increase their provisions against bad loans to third world countries since Citibank announced plans to add three billion dlrs to provisions mid May National Westminster Bank Plc NWBL L largest clearers became first U K Clearers to follow Citicorp s CCI move earlier week when adding some stg to sovereign debt provisions Lloyds second largest exposure to Latin America after Midland Bank smallest four clearers Lloyds reviewing situation Moore denied today s action any connection It totally unrelated he Trading Eurobonds gilts ended by time announcement made But market participants were dumbfounded We only heard news minutes before announcement I no idea coming I don t know if I still job one trader at Lloyds who declined to be identified Lloyds Moore bank do all could to redeploy staff affected by decision other parts bank But even though Lloyds share these markets relatively small other market participants particularly gilts were unnerved One senior gilt market maker noted news comes during period when both gilt Eurosterling markets been battered by lack investor participation following June U K general election Most firms held long positions on expectations return ruling Conservative party prompt heavy demand These expectations failed to be met both markets sustained sizeable losses since election Lloyds long been subject rumors experiencing problems gilt operations officials never denied early stages were unprofitable Gilt market sources suggested one problems facing Lloyds on gilt side decision to build up own team only clearer did purchase broker or jobber middle man run up to Big Bang Under old system these functions been conducted separately but now market makers perform both tasks But even long before Big Bang market makers expressed doubts gilt market be large enough to sustain market makers even if turnover increased substantially Lloyds withdrawal many market makers believe some remaining may opt to bow out gracefully

reuters.unknown: F f reute r f AM INSIDER

text.title: SEC SUPPORTS INSIDER TRADING DEFINITION
text.body: The Securities Exchange Commission supported legislation to define insider trading recommend language such definition within six weeks Acting SEC chairman Charles Cox told Senate Banking Committee bill proposed week to define insider trading as wrongful use material nonpublic information good but contained some ambiguous provisions might reduce Commission s flexibility prosecuting cases The Commission believes definition insider trading desirable Cox He promised to provide SEC s recommended definition to committee by August bill proposed by Sens Donald Riegle Michigan Democrat Alfonse D Amato New York Republican make illegal anyone to receive or pass on inside information even if person providing information did use to make securities transaction Federal law enforcement officials definition insider trading be useful because difficult crime to prove Cox SEC having success insider trading cases despite lack clear definition He became acting chairman agency when chairman John Shad left to become U S Ambassador to Netherlands President Reagan nominated Northwestern University law professor David Ruder as SEC chairman on Wednesday but he may be confirmed by Senate several weeks Riegle chairman Senate securities subcommittee he wanted to act on legislation year but Thomas Moore member President s Council Economic Advisors action should be delayed until Supreme Court ruled on appearl insider trading conviction by former Wall Street Journal reporter R Foster Winans Winans convicted telling friend advance what stocks he going to write his column stocks usually went up or down price depending on Winans recommendation We believe be better to wait until Supreme Court reviewed Winans case before any leigilation considered After court decides case we can better consider how law might be changed Until time legislation premature Moore his testimony

reuters.unknown: C G M T f reute d f BC MALAYSIA TO RESEARCH

text.title: MALAYSIA TO RESEARCH TIN WARY ON VEG OILS TAX
text.author: By Gerrard Raven Reuters
text.body: Malaysia to urge fellow tin producing countries to contribute more money towards research into new uses metal Malaysian primary industries minister Lim Keng Yaik told Reuters interview Lim Brussels on tour Europe America he instructed Malaysia s representatives on executive committee Association Tin Producing Countries ATPC to draw up paper on matter Lim earlier met European Community farm commissioner Frans Andriessen industry commissioner Karl Heinz Narjes He though now appeared likely Commission proposals tax on vegetable marine oils fats be defeated he feared Commission revive idea Lim noted Andriessen week promised if tax adopted third countries suffered export losses as result they be compensated through access to EC alternative exports Since most our products commodity based I cannot see how work out our case Lim Malaysian palm oil exports to EC worth dlrs year tin research proposal be presented at ATPC meeting to be held Kuala Lumpur September Not enough research development effort been put by tin producers we been pushed out by substitutes such as aluminium paper plastics Lim He mentioned use inorganic tin pesticides as exciting possible new application Lim he could estimate amount extra money needed to be spent on research into new uses before new paper produced He Narjes told him there appeared no fundamental barriers to EC states quickly ratifying new International Rubber Agreement INRA although translations accord into some EC languages still being awaited Lim who sign ratify agreement on Malaysia s behalf when he visits New York during his current tour important there should be long interregnum between old agreement lapsing October new one coming into force He described present accord as model commodity agreements due to being signed by nearly all producing consuming countries by virtue review systems control over buffer stock management

reuters.unknown: A RM f reute d f AM TRADE LATAM

text.title: LATIN CARIBBEAN NATIONS OPPOSE TRADE BILLS
text.body: A group Latin American Caribbean nations formally opposed trade legislation pending Congress saying curb their exports slow development hinder ability to repay foreign debt Mario Rodriguez Montero president Organization American States special committee on trade he aware large U S trade deficit but added the region should be one affected by trade bills He causes deficit were strong dollar budget deficit it regrettable to solve by trade bill only serve private U S interests Rodriguez made comment at news conference after two days meetings U S officials on trade bills now Congress designed to reduce U S trade deficit year hit record billion dlrs Congressional observers say bills aimed mainly at Japan Taiwan South Korea few other nations large annual trade surpluses United States Mexico Brazil Venezuela only Latin nations large trade surpluses year United States but even Mexico largest surplus only billion dlrs against Japan s billion dlrs European Community also opposed bills Rodriguez Latin Caribbean nations backed Reagan Administration s opposition to many sections legislation including those to curb imports to require retaliation foreign unfair trade practices He told reporters committee likely mount campaign to fight legislation when comes up debate on Senate floor expected next week Rodriguez the region needs trade to continue development We hope need be affected negatively by trade legislation Rodriguez we need to keep market opens especially U S market to obtain necessary foreign exchange only to service debt but also to continue national development progress President Reagan he veto any legislation he termed protectionist his aides now mounting effort to water down some objectionable provisions legislation Asked whether Reagan ready to cast veto Rodriguez as yet the administration veto frame mind

text.title: BRAZIL S MOTOR INDUSTRY SUFFERS MAJOR SLOWDOWN
text.author: By Stephen Powell Reuters
text.body: Brazil s crisis ridden motor industry dominated by subsidiaries Volkswagen AG VOWG F Fiat Spa FIAT MI General Motor Corp GM Ford Co F made single domestic sale four days several assembly lines stop shortly industry spokesmen motor manufacturers been feeling pinch months demand slumping as country heads into recession But industry hit fresh problem when dealers decided on Tuesday to stop buying any cars or trucks to protest high government taxes on vehicles dealers decision sparked by pct increase car prices authorized week by government to cover industry s rising costs Spokesman Marcio Stefani Brazilian Association Autmotive Vehicle Distributors dealers felt their livelihood at stake cars aren t selling because they cost too much It question our survival price cars Brazil reached insupportable level he GM Opala Diplomata he costs dlrs Brazil while equivalent car United States cost dlrs National Association Automotive Vehicle Manufacturers if trade s boycott continues another week consequences be serious Association spokesman Fred Carvalho told Reuters The consequences first all be collective holidays then lay offs more more catastrophic situation spokesman Ford Brasil tell half workforce to take holidays June July Fiat announced yesterday give workers month s holiday July halting production domestic market Carvalho industry working at vehicles day below average capacity During year s Cruzado Plan price freeze feverish demand far outstripped supply industry says could sold many more cars than produced but constrained by lack parts Today picture completely different after months raging inflation demand all but disappeared Carvalho government taxes on cars added pct to cost vehicle He described taxes as the highest universe galaxy Domestic car sales during first five months year slipped to their lowest level decade units compared units during same period year On bright side exports booming sales abroad May totalled dlrs record figure motor industry critical government President Jose Sarney gained reputation as indifferent manager economy month Volkswagen postponing indefinitely investments dlrs planned year Wolfgang Sauer president Volkswagen do Brasil government created crisis confidence Brazil s motor industry employs more than people

text.body: The Pentagon stopped approving any new military contracts to Japan s Toshiba Corp TSBA T over Toshiba subsidiary s transfer submarine technology to Soviet Union senior defense official We approving any new contracts with Toshiba pending satisfactory resolution entire matter Deputy Assistant Defense Secretary Stephen Bryen told Reuters confirming published reports on matter temporary ban Bryen been effect unofficially since April could cost Toshiba hundreds mlns dlrs electronics business Pentagon including pending dlr Air Force deal small computers Bryen U S military services signed any contracts Toshiba since April when publicity arose over subsidiary Toshiba Machine Co s alleged sale to Moscow milling machines grind silent submarine propellers Japanese government been investigating case previously reported Toshiba Machine sold four large milling machines to Soviet Union late or early But Bryen told Reuters interview Pentagon now been informed by Japanese police at least four more smaller machines capable making such precision propellers were also sold to Kremlin apparently There may be even more beyond I don t know yet Bryen Toshiba known to be seeking U S Air Force contract lap top computers worth some dlrs Air Force called new bids on contract partly because Toshiba investigation Pentagon officials officials who asked to be identified computer contract also being re advertised bidding because changes dlr yen ratio questions raised by U S import restrictions on some Japanese micro electronics Two days ago three U S senators they wanted temporary ban on all U S imports Toshiba Corp products including television sets videotape recorders Senators Jake Garn Utah Richard Shelby Alabama John Heinz Pennslvania they might seek amendment to major trade bill being considered by Senate summer Navy reported to be furious over technology transfer Pentagon officials told Reuters some state of the art propellers already been mounted on Soviet attack submarines Japanese government already prohibited Toshiba Machine Co doing any business Soviet Bloc one year Norweigan state own firm Kongsberg Vaapenfabrikk involved original technology transfer reuters.unknown: F f reute d f BC NEW LEADER COMING TO

text.title: NEW LEADER COMING TO U S SEC IN CHALLENGING ERA
text.author: By Irwin Arieff Reuters
text.body: President Reagan s nominee as top policeman nation s securities markets inherit agency challenged by insider trading scandal wild stock price gyrations host uncertainties stemming globalization financial markets David Ruder year old Republican law professor at Northwestern University Evanston Ill named Thursday to be rd chairman five member U S Securities Exchange Commission If confirmed by Senate as expected he succeed John Shad who left agency earlier week after record six years as chairman to become ambassador to Netherlands SEC been limelight past year as investigators probed into most colossal insider trading scandal ever uncovered on Wall Street investigation still active mushroomed recent months as growing number well known traders prominent investment banking firms been charged wrongdoing pace probe picked up markedly November after Ivan Boesky one Wall Street s most successful stock speculators agreed to cooperate government investigators to pay record dlrs penalties illegal profits after being charged insider trading But agency also wrestling vexing new phenomenon huge rapid swings stock prices spurred by computer driven trading strategies span markets securities options futures price gyrations combined rising trading volumes to bring unprecedented volatility to some U S securities markets At same time SEC being pressed by some lawmakers to put stop to abusive tactics corporate takeover contests as unrelenting wave such takeovers steadily reshapes U S corporate landscape agency being pushed by U S foreign exchanges intent on expansion to lay regulatory groundwork international securities marketplace trading occurs across borders throughout world around clock Such worldwide trading networks offer vast new investment opportunities but could strain SEC s ability to enforce U S securities laws guard investors fraud Under leadership Shad SEC eased financial disclosure requirements publicly traded companies eliminated many minor investor protection rules attempted to spur competition among exchanges streamlined agency s review hostile corporate takeovers Shad who been vice chairman E F Hutton investment banking firm brought Wall Street perspective to agency upon being named chairman line views other top administration officials he favored marketplace determination takeover battles over new federal regulations SEC under Shad also stressed prosecution insider trading violations over corporate wrongdoing cases topped agency s enforcement agenda during administration President Jimmy Carter Democrat Securities lawyers industry officials acquainted Ruder say new chairman designate unlikely to significantly alter commission s current priorities SEC currently employees most them lawyers annual budget dlrs though figure likely be significantly higher next year as agency moves to beef up enforcement staff agency one few government actually taken more money than spent past few years because fees charges public companies investment banks other securities firms regulates SEC structured as independent regulatory agency meaning five commissioners appointed by president to fixed five year terms protected firing policy differences alone By law no more than three commissioners may be same political party agency prepares own budget request each year instead leaving to White House Established by Congress SEC traces origins to great stock market crash attributed large part to widespread trading on credit attempted market manipulations by large investment firms agency requires public companies investment vehicles such as mutual funds to issue periodic reports on their financial condition to disclose changes their condition any time they issue new securities requires brokers dealers investment banks to register comply investor protection rules polices exchanges regulates trading practices first chairman Joseph Kennedy industrial magnate who also father John Kennedy later to become nation s th president Other former chairmen include William Douglas who served until his appointment to U S Supreme Court William Casey who served during President Nixon s first term Reagan s director Central Intelligence Agency until his death earlier year

text.body: Tenneco Inc Tennessee Gas Pipeline Co largest interstate natural gas pipeline transport natural gas under open access rules Federal Energy Regulatory Commission FERC open access gas pipelines serve purely as transport company moving gas suppliers to customers Pipelines also transport own gas to customers Earlier week Transco Energy Co T rejected FERC guidelines saying offer open access until regulatory body offers solution to exposure faces gas bought but could sell exposure faced by industry stems take or pay contracts under pipelines bought gas on long term contracts they could sell problem grew severe as customers won cheaper sources gas because open access Some industry analysts speculated earlier week Tenneco might follow Transco s lead close pipelines to open access because take or pay issue But Tenneco today open access is one steps FERC taking to restructure gas industry U S FERC moving industry through restructuring now even before all transitional problems solved spokesman Tenneco faces billion dlrs exposure under take or pay contracts but he no specific figure Tennessee Gas runs miles pipelines Louisiana Texas up to New England We remain convinced most critical transitional issue facing industry take or pay must be resolved by FERC near future A failure to do so could grave consequences industry s continued ability to provide customers reliable natural gas Tennessee Gas Transmission Co president R C Thomas

reuters.unknown: RM F A f reute u f BC ECONOMY OUTLOOK

text.title: U S ECONOMY SLOWDOWN RAISES RECESSION FEARS
text.author: By Kenneth Barry Reuters
text.body: The economy faces lackluster growth risk recession year if recent improvement U S exports should falter economists say Growth slow sharply next months due to weakness key housing auto sectors could be further hampered unless consumer spending picks up they say These factors raise question there enough strength to keep economy tipping into recession Lyle Gramley chief economist Mortgage Bankers Association former Federal Reserve Board official Commerce Department week economy grew by robust pct annual rate first quarter but U S monetary official called weak report Housing starts fell pct May consumer spending rose weak per cent Our two largest visible industries autos housing faltering but exports picking up some slack Martin Mauro senior economist Merrill Lynch Economics told Reuters Gramley he worried consumer spending may slow because inflation rising faster than real wages To offset U S exports must continue to rise returning enough jobs to manufacturing sector to boost personal income consumption he says I expect to see enough improvement real net exports to keep recession happening but close call Gramley Federal Reserve Board Governor Martha Seger told reporters apparent strength pct growth figure result temporary buildup inventories recovery showing anemia Seger recovery stumbling along The pace economy lack robustness must be factored into monetary policy possibly signal Fed be accommodative Most economists predict growth slower than pct forecast by Reagan administration warn if dollar drops suddenly higher inflation result add to risk recession Mauro pct rise industrial production May came despite cutbacks output auto industry where inventory overhang still exists He says boost production came smaller industries like paper chemicals lumber improved sales overseas due to drop dollar They going to be enough any kind surge economic activity but I think they keep us out recession Mauro speech to financial planners week Beryl Sprinkel chief White House economic adviser predicted trade deficit continue to improve Prospects continued economic growth through into still quite favorable he But private economists raise concerns resurgence inflation Allen Sinai chief economist at Shearson Lehman Brothers Inc told Congress week inflation rise to to five pct year stay at level through after pct increase rise coming sharply lower dollar higher oil energy prices rising prices services he The lesson history once inflation genie gets out bottle continues to persist he adding he like Fed to tighten credit major factor affecting inflation value dollar should continue to fall feed inflation says prominent international banker Rainer Gut chairman Credit Suisse told National Press Club dollar s downward trend against yen mark continue years because United States world s largest debtor nation Swiss banker economic indicators point to further slackening activity called naive belief five year boom on world equity markets go on forever It very difficult to be optimistic Gut

text.title: UPTREND REMAINS INTACT FOR DEBT FUTURES
text.author: by Patricia Campbell Reuters
text.body: The six basis point rise past month U S debt futures may be extended next week by series U S economic reports analysts as long as dollar holds firm Interest rates declined by approximately basis points over month largely over indications inflation as high as people feared narrowing U S trade balance nominal terms Samuel Kahan chief financial economist Kleinwort Benson Government Securities Kahan recent government reports shown strength economy during first quarter but his concern whether U S economy sustain strength longer term Weak U S economic growth could hurt dollar become more important to direction debt futures than beneficial impact on interest rates sluggish economy median trade expectations Tuesday s U S Consumer Price Index Durable Goods reports up pct down pct respectively Meanwhile eight billion dlr drop M money supply announced week surprising much larger than expected according to Kahan Unless quickly reversed such trend will ensure June M growth be negative Kahan Taken conjunction M M aggregates Kahan slowed to crawl below Federal Reserve Board annual targets consequences could be hint economic weakness down road he Based on chart formations T bond futures may be poised further gains although advance been slowed recently analysts September T bonds are up almost six points since May Merrill Lynch debt analyst Jim Duggan noted September bond futures climbed low month ago to over mid June Duggan While follow through buying aided advance so far bouts short covering prohibited slide through chart support rally September T bonds been thwarted above level The level formidable resistance must be taken out before activity anything other than trading range market Carroll McEntee McGinley Futures debt analyst Brian Singer dollar remains key fundamental factor U S currency made little headway late analysts The critical variable remaining market value dollar Kahan Additional influences next week be possible developments ahead OPEC members meeting impact size U S budget deficit although these be forefront market early next week Kahan looking ahead to U S Treasury mini refunding auctions billion T notes on Tuesday Wednesday Thursday Singer market likely greet results little excitement However successful auction could prove to be turning point depending on prevailing market psychology

text.title: CANADA POST SEEKS MEDIATOR VIOLENCE ON PICKET
text.body: Canada Post asked federal government to appoint mediator to help end increasingly violent series strikes by country s letter carriers government expected to respond quickly to request made after union formally rejected corporation s latest offer to settle four day old dispute state run postal service also halt use replacement workers union blamed trouble on picket line We become increasingly concerned safety our employees both striking employees replacement workers at risk Canada Post negotiator Harold Dunstan told reporters at downtown Ottawa hotel Robert McGarry president member Letter Carriers Union told reporters he other union leaders consider suspending walkouts week while mediator involved bid to step up pressure on management letter carriers walked out Toronto today where some pct country s mail sorted Workers also set up picket lines other populous cities southern Ontario but went back to work most other centers across Canada There been several arrests property damage sometimes violent clashes between strikers replacement workers whom corporation hired to try keep mail moving Canadian Union Postal Workers CUPW represents postal employees who letter carriers on strike one workers stabbed now hospital after scuffle broke out replacement worker Toronto early today Police however they no report stabbing CUPW President Jean Claude Parrot called resignation Andre Harvie minister responsible Canada Post condoning use so called strikebreakers The federal government the blood workers on hands postal strike Parrot told reporters at union s Ottawa headquarters

reuters.unknown: F f reute u f BC JUDGE HEARS APPEALS A

text.title: JUDGE HEARS APPEALS AGAINST MANVILLE QMAN PLAN
text.body: A federal judge heard arguments Manville Corp s chapter reorganization plan confirmed December should be thrown out During four and a half hour hearing U S District Judge Whitman Knapp heard arguments five different appeals Whitman took issues under advisement rule at later date Key challenges were made by group Manville shareholders who claim they were adequately represented during bankruptcy proceedings billion dlr fund to pay victims asbestos overfunded Another challenge came group asbestos victims who claimed trust fund underfunded Today Manville lawyers there been claims filed by those injured by asbestos reorganization plan also sets up trust fund initial funding dlrs to pay property damage claims Additional funds be available if needed Manville there currently property damage claims filed Manville filed bankruptcy reorganization plan approved by all parties except common stockholders stockholders objected to proposal because greatly dilute value their holdings plan effect converting every eight shares common stock into just one share Manville lawyers today criticized shareholder groups further delaying execution bankruptcy plan Herbert Edelman one Manville s lawyers pointed out many thousands victims creditors were still awaiting payments many victims already died He also pointed out bankruptcy court found Manville to be insolvent They shareholders want plan put aside to get nebulous value may be down road Edelman Common shareholders claim they were adequately represented because U S Bankruptcy Judge Burton Lifland refused requests to divide equity holders committee into two separate groups one repesenting common shareholders other preferred stock shareholders During confirmation hearings plan equity committee s lawyer George Hahn walked out hearing saying he could represent both groups equity holders committee then abolished unofficial committee representing pct company s stock present at confirmation hearings However lawyers committee did present evidence or cross examine witnesses During today s hearing Paul Gonson Washington lawyer representing Securities Exchange Commission told Judge Knapp agency also concerned shareholders did adequate representation Knapp unofficial committee represented by New York law firm Kronish Lieb Weiner Hellman They one best law firms town Knapp

text.title: TOKYO STOCKS OUTLOOK UNCERTAIN DUE TO YEN OPEC
text.author: By James Kynge Reuters
text.body: Prospects Tokyo stocks mixed week investors trying to figure out future yen dollar exchange rate digest implications OPEC s latest accord on crude output pricing brokers They market should extend dull trend been since share index fell rapidly record close at on June ended at on Saturday fell further morning to close at uncertain reaction to weaker yen weekend OPEC accord Brokers attention could focus more on cheaper less well known stocks exchange s first second sections were generally showing more resilience second section index contrast to first closed at record on June surpassing peak set on June Probably shares companies involved domestic economy good bet broker at Daiwa Securities Co Ltd He his observation based on figures showing business activity Japan booming government on Friday department store supermarket sales rose pct May year earlier while orders received by Japan s major construction firms same month were up pct year on year Brokers expected more such figures but many stocks linked to domestic demand remain overpriced They hard to find but companies attractive niche domestic economy unaffected by currency movements best bet broker at foreign securities house who declined to be identified But sharp rises money supply voracious domestic consumption stirring inflation fears consumer price index rose pct May April third consecutive month on month increase Although investors unduly worried inflation erodes real value stock holdings they say rising prices arouse concern interest rates may climb recent market advances been assuming further cut Japan s pct discount rate Such assumptions now died discouraging investors brokers If oil prices rise stock market Japan could suffer downturn as higher production costs stir inflation But share prices Japan s oil importing companies may also firm brokers I never been able to justify because should mean cost importing rises broker at Yamaichi Securities Co It just always happens Export oriented companies may continue their recent rally if dollar climbs against yen But prices many blue chip exporters risen fast over two weeks making them look less attractive brokers However if dollar falls to or yen market index may rally brokers lower dollar could damp down rising capital outflows into dollar investments Japan s stock bond markets brokers as yen dollar rate supposed to reflect balance trade between United States Japan lower dollar bring more pressure on Japan to expand demand American imports by stimulating local economy brokers If dollar falls buy domestic if rises maybe buy few exporters one foreign broker

text.title: SOUTH KOREAN RULING PARTY ANNOUNCES REFORM PACKAGE
text.body: South Korea s ruling party announced reform package includes recommendation direct presidential elections There no immediate reaction President Chun Doo Hwan but Democratic Justice Party DJP chairman Roh Tae woo who unveiled reforms vowed to resign if they were rejected Roh whose confirmation as government candidate to succeed Chun sparked weeks massive demonstrations around country he withdraw his candidacy quit his DJP post if Chun failed to accept package I reached conclusion I cannot but choose direct presidential election system to overcome social confusion achieve national compromise Roh There no immediate indication how soon Chun react to Roh s proposals or whether he involved their formulation president who took office following military coup due to step down next February after elections tentatively been set December Under Roh s package Chun remain president until his successor chosen by direct elections At present president chosen through electoral college system opposition says stacked favour DJP Among other major changes package offers release most political prisoners guarantee human rights free press Kim Young sam head opposition Reunification Democratic Party I wholeheartedly welcome Chairman Roh s announcement though belated measure Western diplomat told Reuters It s very substantial very courageous move second surprise Roh s proposals amnesty leading dissident Kim Dae jung who been banned politics because suspended sentence sedition charges only opposition demand met by Roh s package RDP s insistence Chun should step down immediately

text.body: New Zealand s opposition National Party cut personal business taxes regulate or control interest rates if returned to power economic strategy unveiled by party leader Jim Bolger one day before prime minister David Lange announces date general elections widely expected to be August National Party s tax policies included abolition death gift duties removal indirect taxes on basic food doctors fees most recent opinion poll taken on June gave Labour point lead over National or eight points more than month earlier National under administration New Zealand dollar find level complementary fiscal monetary policies party did elaborate Controversy over National s economic policy erupted March when former prime minister Robert Muldoon party adopted policy managed exchange rate Bolger then National Party continue to float dollar Since dollar floated by Labour Party March risen pct cutting export incomes farmers who traditional National Party supporters party tight monetary policies alone lead to unrealistic exchange rates be out line exporters unless they were supported by low government borrowing requirement shrinking government sector positive growth aimed to keep aspects deregulation benefitted New Zealanders while cutting government spending unemployment interest rates inflation tax National Party intends to privatise totally Bank New Zealand Development Finance Corporation Tourist Hotel Corporation Petrocorp State Insurance Government Life Office party Other candidates privatisation such as Air New Zealand Ltd be considered when share market could absorb them

text.title: ZIMBABWE WAGE FREEZE SHOWS ECONOMIC MALAISE
text.author: By Andrew Rusinga Reuters
text.body: Zimbabwe s temporary freeze on salaries wages prices give economy breather but radical economic reforms needed to resuscitate business attract foreign investment economists They June freeze on government state company private sector wages until January postponed rather than provided solutions to Zimbabwe s economic problems They urged review tax system introduction investment incentives review foreign exchange price controls check on government expenditure These measures aim to stimulate investment create employment school leavers annually seeking jobs freeze Finance Minister Bernard Chidzero check production costs reduce budget deficit been partly welcomed by business but criticised by workers whose real purchasing power been severely eroded since government announced freeze amid worsening economic crisis caused by serious drought budget deficit more than one billion Zimbabwean dlrs acute balance payments problem owing to debt service costs now U S Dlrs on external debt two billion U S Dlrs crisis forced country to make companies halve dividend remittances to overseas shareholders Zimbabwe National Chamber Commerce supported freeze on wages salaries but criticised promised stricter control prices goods services If those companies whose costs production increase allowed price increase profit margins again be severely squeezed negate current government efforts to revitalise economy chamber Zimbabwe Congress Trade Unions freeze worsen plight lowest paid workers union body been campaigning minimum monthly wage Zimbabwean dlrs U S Dlrs lowest paid now earn dollars U S Dlrs Inflation hitting hardest those low income bracket demands any economic recovery programme should be biased their favour union body added promised price freeze bolting stable door when fact horse gone because prices most basic commodities already risen phenomenally Both unions business hope freeze heralds return to wage bargaining between workers employers rather than government regulated pay awards Zimbabwe since set annual minimum wages different sectors economy awarded wage salary increments on sliding scale gave higher increases to lowest paid
