text.title: BANK OF JAPAN WORRIES ABOUT MARKET COLLAPSE
text.author: By Rich Miller Reuters
text.body: The Bank Japan become increasingly worried possible crash high flying financial markets Bank Japan sources We re afraid someday bubble burst deflationary impact on economy be very disastrous one source They central bank embarked on delicate policy wants to deflate speculation pumped up prices sharply recent months without bursting bubble Stock prices plunged points today extending sharp declines earlier month as market speculated interest rates rise Bank Japan bought billion yen certificates deposit CDs via repurchase agreements today to show determination to maintain easy money policy central bank officials Today s CD buying operation designed to reassure market Bank changed policy senior central Bank official told Reuters There possibility deflationary impact permeate economy if prices existing assets collapsed Bank Japan earlier month annual economic report Such possibility been heightened by what Bank sees as excessive speculation stock bond land prices Over two years stock market average doubled driving price earnings ratios to over compared on Wall Street Bond yields dropped sharply while land prices Tokyo soared excessive speculation means markets increasingly out touch economic reality thus more vulnerable one central bank source collapse now could rob businessmen consumers what little confidence they economy after yen induced recession past year private economists Some hard pressed exporters already make greater profits through financial dealings than their basic businesses they There seems to be accelerated demand money to support transactions shares bonds land other existing assets little bearing on value added therefore on GNP Bank Japan report increased inclination investors to seek capital gains accompanying rise prices existing assets could dangerous implications economy added Bank s view major reason behind skyrocketing prices own easy monetary policy belief market interest rates were heading inexorably lower Mindful potential inflationary dangers posed by excessive liquidity Central Bank s board recently decided to spell out clearly to markets further discount rate cut offing one source But bank to do without tightening monetary policy running risk market collapse achieved partly by rise short term interest rates Bank sources ascribed to seasonal pressures to change market expectations While denying bank tightening monetary policy senior source welcomed change market expectations source acknowledged shift may been caused partly by decision to press commercial banks to limit lending July September period Faster than expected economic growth strong dollar also played part longer run Central Bank counting on gradual upturn economy to draw liquidity financial markets into productive areas like capital spending one Bank Japan economist But while waits to occur over next six months may to avoid any overt tightening monetary policy could collapse market lead to recession

text.title: HIGHER REVENUES DEAL BLOW TO JAPAN TAX REFORM PLAN
text.author: By Rich Miller Reuters
text.body: Prime Minister Yasuhiro Nakasone s diminishing hopes overhauling tax system been dealt serious blow by reports sharply higher than expected tax revenues government officials Nakasone argued tax system must be reformed to provide revenue more than billion yen tax cuts promised government s emergency economic package month But his argument been undercut by reports tax take as much as billion yen more than expected means government should more than enough money fiscal year ending next March to pay planned tax cuts without having recourse to unpopular tax measures proposed by Nakasone one official Prime Minister proposed indirect tax abolition tax breaks on small savings as ways raising revenue to offset tax cuts But stiff opposition forced him to shelve idea indirect tax at least time being He still hopes to gain parliamentary approval next month to abolish tax breaks on small savings higher than expected revenues partly stemmed increased receipts land securities taxes as prices both shares land soared one official But corporate tax revenues also been more buoyant than expected perhaps indicating recession year induced by strong yen as bad as thought he final figures revenues due to be released by Finance Ministry on July higher revenues fiscal year also undercut attempts by Finance Ministry s budget bureau to reduce investment spending by government departments budget several officials budget bureau official bureau still wanted to stick so called minus ceiling policy calls government departments to reduce investment spending by five pct year But he acknowledged be difficult given sharp increase revenues fiscal year heavy domestic U S Pressure on ministry to stimulate economy

shareholders meeting largely cleared management Volkswagen blame But mud sticks Gavin Launder analyst Scrimgeour Vickers London See index on ECRA financial daily Boersenzeitung wrote commentary More meeting Many market analysts especially London do believe sharp rise VW s share price week reflects major reassessment firm on basis auditors report stock closed at marks on Friday up pct week earlier Dealers referrred to short term bargain hunting one London broker I m sure s much bargain Most brokers they recommend clients to buy at these levels Analysts believe VW do well to match group net reuters.unknown: C T f reute u f BC COLOMBIA OPTIMISTIC O
reuters.text: COLOMBIA OPTIMISTIC ON COFFEE QUOTAS repeat from late yesterday MEDELLIN Colombia June Colombia considers conditions are favourable for reestablishing coffee export quotas but Brazil believes that difficulties remain with the United States coffee leaders from the two countries said Colombia considers that if the principal International Coffee Organisation ICO members adopt a realistic and objective approach it will be possible to find a solution at the next meeting in London Colombian Coffee Federation president Jorge Cardenas said at a coffee symposium The symposium has raised hopes that producers would find a common position on quota distribution before a September ICO plenary meeting in London when quotas will be the main item on the agenda Cardenas representing the world s second largest coffee producer said all producer countries as well as consumer countries including the United States Japan and the European Community had expressed an interest in reestablishing quotas However the President of the Brazilian Coffee Institute Jorio Dauster told Reuters that problems remained between the United States and Brazil By the end of the February meeting it was shown that pct of the producer countries were with Brazil he said However up to now I have not seen fundamental changes in their positions ICO talks on quotas broke down in February largely due to a conflict between the world s main producer Brazil and main consumer the United States ICO director Alexandre Beltrao said at the symposium that conditions were right to discuss reestablishing export quotas He said the strong views of Brazil and United States expressed in February had abated Confirmation of the bumper crop in Brazil is good for prices and compels countries to seek agreement on basic quotas Beltrao told Reuters Brazilian authorities have said the crop for coffee season could be mln kg bags he added Beltrao spoke of the presence of new factors that work against the stability of the ICO created years ago Foreign debt and as a result worse economic political and social conditions make the adoption of a national and international coffee strategy more difficult he said The ICO board would meet in July to discuss these matters Reuter

reuters.unknown: Y f reute u f BC INTERNATIONAL SPOT OI

text.title: INTERNATIONAL SPOT OIL PRICES FIRM ON OPEC ACCORD
text.author: By Karen Yates Reuters
text.body: OPEC s weekend decision to cut planned oil output levels second half renewed market confidence oil price outlook rest year boosted international spot prices oil traders Spot crude prices now standing cents barrel higher than at start OPEC meeting Thursday could continue their rise next few weeks they new optimism springs agreement reached by OPEC ministers Vienna on Saturday to fix July December output ceiling barrels per day bpd At previous meeting December OPEC set provisional bpd output limit third quarter but proposed sharp rise to fourth ceilings were to back up newly restored fixed prices around dlrs barrel When signs first emerged Friday OPEC contemplating cutting planned fourth quarter ceiling spot prices most widely traded crude oil Britain s Brent Blend surged cents barrel Traders trend continued cautious rally morning London taking quoted levels up to around dlrs compared dlrs middle week Most traders on international oil markets reacted bullishly to news final agreement They forecast tight supplies later year when demand oil increases onset Northern Hemisphere winter further rises spot prices There be scramble oil third fourth quarters year one trader In past three months we already seen rise demand particularly U S I expect to see even higher prices he added Mehdi Varzi analyst stockbroker Kleinwort Grieveson London agreed Varzi told Reuters OPEC if anything too cautious setting new output ceilings There now great chance Brent crude oil hit dlrs barrel next month he Laurie Law analyst at E F Hutton Co Inc New York over weekend she saw spot price West Texas Intermediate WTI rallying to around dlrs by end year just over dlrs now WTI U S Benchmark crude usually fetches premium cents to one dlr over Brent So far year spot Brent held mostly between dlrs barrel But some traders fearing continued over production by some OPEC members sounded note caution over new accord Iraq again refused to be party to agreement because other OPEC ministers turned down repeated demand same production quota as Gulf War enemy Iraq recent months Iraq been producing bpd above assigned quota could begin pumping further bpd when new export pipeline comes on stream September According to Kuwaiti oil minister Sheikh Ali al Khalifa al Sabah actual OPEC production fourth quarter could be well above official ceiling at nearly bpd

reuters.unknown: F f reute d f BC TECHNOLOGY

text.title: TECHNOLOGY ALTERNATIVES TO IBM SOFTWARE STANDARD
text.author: By Catherine Arnst Reuters
text.body: In fast paced personal computer industry millions can be made six months such opportunity may exist now companies seeking to capitalize on delay new IBM software standard When International Business Machines Corp IBM announced new generation personal computers PS family April also decided to establish new operating system machines death sentence billions dollars software now use on existing system Because IBM world s largest computer company some pct world s computers bear IBM logo most industry analysts even IBM s competitors expect within two years new operating system called OS be as commonplace as current standard MS DOS now By at least one half to pct all personal computers be sold OS predicted George Colony president consulting firm Forrester Research Inc But until then there opportunity some analysts firms selling advanced versions MS DOS specialised multi tasking software packages Unix alternative to MS DOS developed by American Telephone Telegraph Co T developed following among engineers federal government OS IBM developing Microsoft Corp author MS DOS be ready another six months IBM week product on schedule but analysts other software developers skeptical since delays major new software products commonplace Initial acceptance new system most likely be hindered by disgruntlement hardware software vendors alike who prefer to keep making products work tried true MS DOS according to Paul Cubbage software analyst market research firm Dataquest Inc Compaq IBM s major personal computer competitor already stick MS DOS standard Compaq president Rod Canion recently their be no automatic mass migration to OS Advanced MS DOS applications continue to meet far broader set users needs than OS supply long after becomes available he Cubbage acknowledged it probably be year or more before any really useful applications available OS creating opportunities multi tasking programs But there comes time when memory limits those gets to you he IBM s new operating system as big event to computer industry as PS announcement itself new computers most powerful use Intel Corp s fast microprocessor expected to rejuvenate sagging sales personal computer industry already gave big boost to IBM Company officials week PS s were shipped months since their introduction IBM expect record pc sales ths year as result enthusiasm PS particularly striking since full potential powerful computers cannot be tapped until new operating system or other high level software available analysts OS allow users to work on many different programs or tasks at once on personal computer ideally without any slowdown operation capability industry long strived Microsoft already promising alternatives to OS particular advanced version Windows multitasking program used conjunction MS DOS Microsoft chairman Bill Gates suggested advanced version program Windows be announced September available six to eight weeks later at price dlrs dlrs OS expected to cost dlrs Some software developers program designed based personal computers may even be superior to OS allowing users to multitask applications without disruption But several analysts commented what users really want multi taksing operating system based personal computers so far desire been met primarily by small Atlanta software publisher Software Link Inc late spring company announced PC MOS multi tasking multiuser operating system compatible MS DOS works on based computers company filled orders first four weeks availability expects shipments to reach by year end International Data Corp analyst Zachmann Unix could be most promising alternative to OS even once IVM system available IBM did endorse Unix any PS models although did say announce version Advanced Interactive Executive AIX Unix compatible operating system But federal government requires Unix compatability most computer contracts almost certain other companies provide Unix style operating systems IBM systems ATT itself two weeks ago introduced version Unix compatible microprocessor although IBM s computer specifically Analysts saw announcement as move to get Unix accepted as strong alternative to OS before IBM system chance to take off

text.title: ALLIS CHALMERS AH FILES FOR CHAPTER
text.body: Allis Chalmers Corp company domestic affiliates filed voluntary petitions reorganization under Chapter Federal Bankruptcy Code U S Bankruptcy Court Southern District New York company business units outside United States affected by action Allis Chalmers rapid agreement essential restructuring plan announced March However company agreement could be worked out within short time frame available determined only practical alternative to obtain court protection This protection enables us to keep on operating our business ordinary course while affording us time to work out our obligations complete our operational restructure strategy Allis Chalmers proposal announced March called complete restructuring obligations capital structure as well as major structural changes operations company funds generated by U S operations currently inadequate to meet U S obligations primarily due to carryover discontinued drastically downsized businesses funds produced by non U S operations readily available to help meet those obligations include health care program retirees debt service carried over larger Allis Chalmers earlier years Allis Chalmers U S cash flow exceeded negative dlrs negative two dlrs first quarter company financed portion debt service other obligations through sales assets relied on short term waivers lenders to prevent defaults on principal interest payments Because Allis Chalmers financial position new financing facilities were available outside Chapter adding substantially all U S assets other than inventory pledged as security debts

reuters.unknown: F f reute h f BC RYZHKOV CALLS FOR SOV

text.title: RYZHKOV CALLS FOR SOVIET ECONOMIC REFORMS
text.body: Soviet Prime Minister Nikolai Ryzhkov described Soviet Union s economic management system as obsolete called on Supreme Soviet nominal parliament to adopt draft law on major economic reform speech to member body Ryzhkov excessive central control by Moscow based ministries wasteful use resources led to situation where pct Soviet industrial enterprises were making loss He public faced acute food housing problems shadow economy growing because state could meet demand He added USSR failed to keep up technology revolution The methods past system economic management become obsolete Ryzhkov declared The need change evident urgent Kremlin leader Mikhail Gorbachev who set tone week frank speech on economy present during speech legislation outlined by Ryzhkov formally called draft law on state enterprises expected to be approved by Supreme Soviet to take effect next January Under law all enterprises to become financially self supporting by taking charge income outlay wages tied to profit order to increase worker incentive Firms compete orders state due to decline as direct contracts between enterprises expand Ryzhkov state planning agency Gosplan be restructured to set national economic priorities instead administering factories directly through five year plans We need fundamentally new approach to yearly planning he added saying annual central plans be abandoned enterprises charged developing their own plans He scientific research should be integrated closely industry to make up technology gap West enterprises should use market research to meet consumer demand Ryzhkov blamed state supply body Gossnab allowing shortages to occur He Gossnab hoarding billion roubles worth raw materials semi finished products enterprises He Gossnab should help expand wholesale trade Ryzhkov improved economic management consumer goods services required to stem increasing speculation growth black market economy He called fold increase number cooperatives to help field He price system needed radical revision to accurately reflect supply demand state setting prices only products national importance changes to be fully place by next five year plan beginning practice using credit to cover losses must also stop Outstanding debts to state reached billion roubles He there were proposals to replace cumbersome banking system six new banks state bank banks foreign economic relations agro industry construction housing commercial services credit Ryzhkov guarantees should be built into law to prevent the distortion rights enterprises But non profitable enterprises be declared bankrupt if efforts to make them self supporting failed Bemoaning economic illiteracy many managers he called retraining economic personnel Ryzhkov immense amount work lay ahead doing on go be difficult but added We do time to stop ponder He changes should give new image to socialism

text.author: By Anthony Williams Reuters
text.body: West Germany s foreign trade current account surpluses expected to decline only slightly their record levels year economists Figures released by Federal Statistics Office Wiesbaden showed first five months year trade surplus grew pct compared same period to billion marks current account surplus rose pct to billion marks West Germany reported current account surplus billion marks trade surplus billion marks Economists expected rise mark year ago levels to started biting more strongly into nominal surpluses real surpluses already declining Statistics Office after cheaper import prices were taken into consideration West Germany s imports by volume rose by more than three pct first five months Exports risen by only one pct real terms government pointed to stronger real rise imports than exports when rejecting international pressure to boost domestic consumption Statistics Office West Germany s trade surplus risen May to billion marks billion April billion May year current account surplus risen to billion marks May billion April billion marks year earlier Exports rose strongly year ago month by pct to billion marks while May imports billion marks risen only pct year Ifo economic research institute Munich study published today trade surplus probably only fall to around billion marks year compared billion mark record predicted fall current account surplus to billion marks billion Ifo reduction only be a small step on way to reducing imbalances world economy Peter Pietsch economist Commerzbank AG predicted trade surplus billion marks He saw slightly higher current account surplus than Ifo possibly billion marks Helmut Henschel Westdeutsche Landesbank put trade surplus at billion marks current account surplus at billion marks He strong rise exports May year ago period surprising but probably reflected calendar factors

reuters.unknown: V RM f reute r f AM BUDGET SCHEDULED

text.title: REAGAN SAID OPEN TO DEAL ON U S TAX RISE
text.author: By Irwin Arieff Reuters
text.body: President Reagan willing to compromise Democrats Congress on plan to raise new federal revenues next year if they back his plan to reform budget process White House Budget Chief James Miller If Democrats want to insist president say whatever agreed to tax increase then they d better just forget because he s going to do Miller interview Reuters But there lot revenues other than those president proposed in his January budget plan I think we might look seriously at he added Reagan budget been widely criticized by both Democrats Republicans Congress envisages raising billion dlrs new revenues through sale package government assets new fees on certain federal services President Reagan repeatedly vowed to veto any tax increase voted by Congress financial year arguing cutting domestic spending better way to reduce huge federal deficit deficit totaled billion dlrs year expected to decline to billion dlrs year fall to billion dlrs next year under budget blueprint recently approved by Congress one trillion dlr congressional budget plan contains billion dlr additional revenues new taxes government s budgetary year beginning October plan does say how additional revenues to be raised leaving to House Ways Means Senate Finance committees to fill details later year Miller appeared to be signaling president might consider some sort tax increase despite his frequently stated rejection concept However Miller declined to say new revenue sources might be acceptable to president I think be counterproductive me to set out options might suggest we one thing or another mind White House budget chief He cautioned Congress political repercussions certain moves such as raising excise taxes on beer cigarettes or telephone service or raising corporate or personal income tax rates I think those Congress who think be simple matter to go along some increase excise taxes underestimating what they be getting themselves into he What they don t really realize political opposition they going to feel to excise taxes going to be lot hotter tahn political opposition to user fees certain ways or asset sales he continued But there lot other things revenue issues government probably ought to be addressed he Before agreeing to revenue package president insist on reform budget process Miller The president going to take sucker punch He s going to sit down try to negotiate out budget when we can t be sure whatever president agrees to fact be delivered he emphasized We d like to budget process gives us contract so if president agrees to something he can depend on coming through After returning to United States economic summit Venice earlier month President Reagan revived earlier unsuccessful campaign budget reform calling constitutional amendment requiring balanced budget power called line item veto to block individual items congressional spending bills At Venice summit U S trading partners called on Washington to cut budget deficit to help reduce global trade imbalances Miller told Italian journalist here yesterday U S trading partners have to faith trust ability United tates to deal problems He deficit cut to billion dlrs year is optimal rate reduction deficit I don t think we can end deficit overnight I think we ve got to gradual reduction over period several years Miller Beaver Creek attending sixth annual World Forum gathering current former government officials business representatives discussing world economic political issues

reuters.unknown: C M f reute d f BC CHANCES OF DIRECT U S

text.title: CHANCES OF DIRECT U S IRAN GULF CLASH SEEN LOW
text.author: By Rory Channing Reuters
text.body: U S moves to increase warships around Mideast Gulf could trigger more attacks on unprotected merchant ships but run little risk sparking direct military clash Iran diplomats They American decision inevitably carries some risk armed confrontation but Iran despite blunt rhetoric want to avoid as much as Washington As Iran knows very well what America bringing into Gulf could do serious damage one western diplomat Diplomats see greatest potential danger more attacks on soft targets such as merchant shipping protected by American or other western navy vessels patrolling Gulf risk Iranian attack on U S Warships or Kuwaiti oil tankers carrying U S Flag under naval escort rated by diplomats as low However There threat Iranians seeing these heavily protected U S flag tankers go softer targets one diplomat Tehran Radio quoted Iran s top defence spokesman Ali Akbar Hashemi Rafsanjani as saying yesterday Washington moving to brink armed encounter us U S increasing Gulf fleet seven to warships sending refurbished battleship Missouri to patrol just outside Strait Hormuz build up ties U S plans to start escorting Kuwaiti oil tankers next month been re registered to fly American flag to give them naval protection Shipping serving Kuwait come under repeated attack by Iran angered at emirate s war backing Iraq Concern region mounted over threat posed by Chinese made Silkworm missiles U S says Iran preparing to deploy near Strait Hormuz Missouri four escort flotilla likely to make Iran think twice using missiles diplomats military source Gulf Iran also set up launching site Silkworms on captured Iraqi soil Faw peninsula within range Kuwait But anything went as far as direct attack on Kuwaiti territory be very serious escalation likely moving world opinion against Iran remarked one Some diplomats believe Iran could also consider carrying out reprisals against United States outside Gulf Rafsanjani who also parliamentary leader predicted Friday a river blood throughout world event any U S strike against Iran Western diplomats Iran Washington accused being behind state sponsored terrorism no demonstrable capacity to carry out attacks U S itself Diplomats saw few potential targets Lebanon now most Americans left wake kidnappings linked to pro Iranian groups But Europe Asia were potential trouble spots Kuwait one most obvious targets Any backlash likely to take form sabotage or other action to make difficult to blame Iran they added

text.body: The Securities Exchange Commission charged Allied Stores Corp failing to promptly disclose key steps taking September to thwart takeover attempt by Campeau Corp administrative complaint SEC Allied legal adviser failed to promptly inform shareholders agency begun talks Youngstown Ohio shopping center developer Edward DeBartolo response to Campeau s takeover offer Campeau acquired Allied estimated billion dlrs on Jan following battle DeBartolo On Sept day after Allied disclosed board urged rejection Campeau s Sept tender offer dlrs share Allied began negotiating sale six shopping centers to DeBartolo SEC Allied legal advisor director George Kern who heads merger acquisitions group at New York law firm Sullivan Cromwell decided against amending Allied s SEC filing to disclose talks even though they resulted sales price dlrs shopping centers Securities law requires takeover target companies to promptly disclose such things as sale major assets day after Campeau increased tender offer to pct Allied s stock pct raised bid to dlrs share dlrs on Sept Allied partnership headed by DeBartolo began negotiating takeover deal aimed at thwarting Campeau SEC Kern again decided against disclosing talks amended SEC filing agency charged Allied s first disclosure DeBartolo takeover made on Oct even though board approved merger on Oct merger agreement executed on Oct complaint DeBartolo Campeau later engaged bitter battle control Allied Campeau winning out later October when bought block shares Allied stock or pct total controversial move made only minutes after dropped hostile tender offer acquisition additional pct federal judge allowed to be completed gave Campeau majority stake Allied Campeau bought rest at dlrs share SEC planned to file court brief joining Allied charging Campeau engaged illegal tender offer But SEC brief never filed since case dropped following agreement between Campeau DeBartolo administrative proceeding against Allied Kern SEC asking administrative order they comply reporting provisions securities laws future Although Allied no longer publicly traded since became subsidiary Campeau still files annual quarterly reports to SEC because outstanding debt

reuters.unknown: E A RM f reute u f BC BC CANADA SCHEDULED

text.title: CANADA SETS OFF ITS OWN BIG BANG
text.author: By Peter Cooney Reuters
text.dateline: TORONTO June Echoes of London s Big Bang
text.body: stock market deregulation be heard Tuesday when Canadian securities industry sets off own fireworks Some companies quickly taking advantage deregulation but more significant moves likely to be year or more down road analysts say They say most foreign firms focus at first on bond trading debt financing underwriting areas they experience under old rules allowed them to provide government debt financing advisory services When they learn Canada they might go into retail Carney at Merrill Lynch Canada Then they eventually just start to buy up little guys If bigger boys price comes down they ll end up taking those ones over too Under new rules barriers kept banks brokerage houses insurance companies trust firms out each others businesses be swept away favor wide open competition deregulation sometimes nicknamed Little Bang allow Canadian banks other domestic financial institutions to set up securities units or acquire existing brokerages Foreign companies also be able to form their own securities divisions Ontario or buy up to pct Canadian firm year now they can raise stake to pct Foreign firms entered Canada after can currently own no more than pct Canadian brokerage Deregulation expected to generate major shakeout by June involving mergers existing firms buyouts by foreign domestic financial giants So far few deals become reality however despite swirl rumors merger talks heat deregulation fever many Canadian investment dealers demanding up to four times book value scaring off prospective suitors analysts I think they the brokerages to lower their asking prices financial services analyst Jeff Carney at Merrill Lynch Canada Inc recently terminated talks to acquire prominent Canadian brokerage Burns Fry Ltd I think a high asking price what scared Merrill Lynch away Burns Fry added Carney It just lot money When your asset walks out door every night difficult to pay amount cash Carney another factor slow pace buyouts uncertainty final deregulation rules were issued approved only mid June Most major foreign Canadian financial players focused their deregulation strategy on planning their own Canadian securities units or buying seats on Toronto Stock Exchange Canada s largest equities market Japan s Nomura Securities Co Ltd Yamaichi Securities Co Ltd Daiwa Securities Co Ltd Nikko Securities Co Ltd recently bought seats on Toronto s exchange while United States investment banks such as Salomon Inc Goldman Sachs Co set plans Canadian subsidiaries few proposed foreign investments Ontario firms include agreements by New York s Shearson Lehman Brothers Inc to raise stake McLeod Young Weir Ltd to pct pct by British firm James Capel Co to acquire minority interest Brown Baldwin Nisker Ltd Several industry watchers predict flood foreign acquisitions likely year away when newcomers become familiar Canada Canadian firms need such international alliances to compete increasingly global securities market industry officials That one hopes regulators change throw off one or two Canadian global firms Toronto Stock Exchange president Pearce Bunting told Reuters recently Canada s six major banks also expected to proceed cautiously into securities field Analysts brokers too expensive now while banks coping Brazilian loan problems Banks also find tough to merge their cautious bureaucratic culture leaner more free wheeling securities dealers they While banks been approached by securities firms seeking merger partners they yet bought into brokerages choosing to build securities units within week Royal Bank Canada country s biggest bank ended merger talks Canadian broker Wood Gundy Inc after several months negotiations But analyst Thompson forecast if one bank finally acquires existing firm all other banks jump They don t want to be perceived as missing out on something Prudential Bache Securities Canada Ltd analyst Albert Thompson who believes brokerages too expensive risk banks

text.body: A North Sea oil find announced by Chevron Corp s CHV Chevron Exploration North Sea Ltd may indicate new field recoverable crude oil reserves barrels industry analysts Chevron sidetrack well on block on U K Continental shelf tested barrels per day bpd API crude oil tertiary Alba sand through three inch surface choke The estimated amount oil at Alba field around barrels Paul Spedding stockbroker Kleinwort Grieveson Co told Reuters He industry estimates put total reserves at field at over one billion barrels but given low gravity oil recovery rate be expected to be around pct Analysts results were encouraging but potential difficulty operating recovering oil field shown by fact first well to be plugged sidetrack drilled The field seems to be shallow widespread require multi platform development recovery pushing costs up Christopher Osborne stockbroker Hoare Govett Most analysts although low gravity oil found require additional costs recovery test well showed flows well Although gravity oil at field seems to be low seems to flow quite well around barrels could be recovered Carol Bell Phillips Drew told Reuters However Chevron officials declined to comment on analysts reserve estimates They without further research drilling area summer they disclose any reserve figures Analysts if field were declared commercial developed there be ready local market heavy crude produced Most refineries now upgraded to refine heavy oils price differentials between heavy light crudes lot narrower today Osborne Chevron operates block on behalf companies include British Petroleum Development Ltd DSM Hydrocarbons UK Ltd Enterprise Oil TNS Ltd Marathon Int Pet GB Ltd Phillips Petroleum Co U K Ltd

reuters.unknown: RM A f reute r f BC U S LEADS JAPAN IN F

text.title: U S LEADS JAPAN IN FINANCIAL FUTURES BUSINESS
text.author: By Hisanobu Ohse Reuters
text.body: U S firms expected to enjoy advantage superior experience over their Japanese competitors new promising business bringing asset rich Japanese investors to U S financial futures markets Japan allowed local financial institutions month to start using overseas futures currencies bonds stocks to help them manage their bulging foreign portfolios U S investment banks going to take advantage We ve been business two decades Japanese Eugene Atkinson president Goldman Sachs Japan Corp Japanese investors were assumed to be eager to get into new markets but fact participation so far been slow Japanese securities bank sources New York Koichi Kane Executive Vice President Nomura Securities International They re still starting up period They re testing water Atkinson added But once they start Japanese likely to become very big players opening up lucrative business opportunities he U S investment banking sources slow start understandable because U S institutional investors too fairly new to market Futures markets long history U S but because high risks involved American pension funds mutual funds were allowed to use markets until relatively recently U S investment bank futures analyst addition to Japan s inexperience financial futures insufficient number brokers Japan also to be blamed slow start Japanese sources Japan liberalizing financial markets but domestic financial institutions still allowed to act as brokers Japan overseas futures markets may change next year when bankers speculate securities houses be permitted to enter line business While Japanese out business Americans moved First Boston Corp Salomon Brothers Inc Goldman Sachs Co Drexel Burnham Lambert Inc PainWebber Inc leading charge they U S Nikko Securities Co International Inc preparing to become clearing member Chicago Boad Trade CBT in anticipation growing Japanese demand futures products Akira Tokutomi Nikko Nomura Japan s largest securities house yet decided whether to expand futures brokerage business U S to establish closer links between Japanese investors U S futures markets Kane evening session CBT inaugurated recently to coincide early Tokyo business hours increased Japanese participation to some extent but brokerage issue still hurdle Japanese sources High liquidity biggest attraction futures market so Japanese naturally want to join daytime trading session Chicago if possible they Japanese process selecting brokers establishing channels to pay fees margins but harmonizing clerical procedures bridging time gap between Tokyo Chicago proving to be burden sources Some Japanese banks largely barred securities industry Japan contemplated buying into U S brokerage business Japanese sources One motives doing so to save on commissions also spur U S commercial banks to get into brokerage business they The simplest way may be to take over brokerage house or to go into business tie up Hiroyuki Kondo Yasuda Trust Banking Co Ltd New York One trust bank source total fees could amount to around one dlrs year if his bank used futures markets fully to hedge huge pension fund other assets Japanese banks been able to penetrate aggressively many foreign financial markets by mobilizing their mammoth capital assets but futures brokerage business to be different story Japanese banking sources They cited stiff fee cutting competition addition to difficulties recruiting influential Chicago brokers anticipation sizeable orders future some U S brokers now taking orders Japanese at around dlrs per contract below break even level they Some Chicago brokers brokerage houses trying to approach Japanese financial institutions possible tie ups futures indusry source Chicago But Japanese bank sources New York small capital base many these brokerages making Japanese nervous capital link Japanese banks unlikely to ignore brokerage business once financial futures trading by Japanese starts growing fast proves to be profitable they But big question they added whether Japanese government let banks engage new risky business

text.body: Sales new single family homes tumbled pct May April levels because higher mortgage interest rates analysts There should be another month or two very weak new home sales but interest rates stabilizing sale new homes should become more stable by mid summer economist Lawrence Chimerine Wharton Econometrics Inc drop May to seasonally adjusted annual rate units largest since January Commerce Department Interest rates on conventional mortgages bottomed out at pct March rose to pct April according to Stephen Roach economist at Morgan Stanley effect to freeze some potential new homebuyers out market he others The rates moved very suddenly were certainly unexpected by homebuyers Cynthia Latta economist Data Resources They were so startled they wanted to hold back see what happen drop sales new single family home sales sharper than expected some economists We fully expected decline but extent more than we anticipated James Christian chief economist U S League Savings Institutions Christian there sharp rise May sales existing homes generally less expensive than new homes Latta Data Resources strong sales new condominiums Northeast on West Coast were reflected sales existing but new homes Christian U S League Savings Institutions Underlying housing demand remains strong I think market going to stabilize give us good second half Others were less optimistic however We clearly won t boom in new home sales but I don t think start collapse single family housing Chimerine Wharton Eugene Sherman chief economist Federal Home Loan Bank New York The lower sales level be maintained awhile until there another change rates There won t be much specific improvement coming months

reuters.unknown: C G T f reute d f BC BRAZIL LAND REFORM PR

text.title: BRAZIL LAND REFORM PROGRAM FALTERS TENSIONS RISE
text.author: By Stephen Powell Reuters
text.body: Brazil s land reform program long trumpeted by government as one absolute priorities mired bureaucracy after achieving very few aims Officials acknowledge progress now minimal Land rights activists see no progress at all say things actually worsening Over year economic pressures forced many small producers to sell out to big land owners Land reform one country s most hotly debated political issues particularly to fore year as Constituent Assembly Brasilia draws up new constitution Land rights campaigners say if new charter does give fresh hope country s landless families there be wave upon wave land occupations We make no secret our tactics one leader land reform movement Joao Pedro The solution to occupy what we say to rural workers There been single program land reform world without people occupying land land issue spawns violence Amazonia to Mato Grosso Some people died land disputes year according to Pastoral Commission Land linked to Roman Catholic Church land reform program announced soon after civilian government President Jose Sarney took power aimed to resettle families by by gradually splitting up country s vast undeveloped estates government National Plan Agrarian Reform described program as one absolute priorities practice fewer than families been helped so far government admits get anywhere near original target Political analysts pace land reform now slower under Sarney than been under military government General Joao Figueiredo slow progress on issue fuelling deep frustration Land rights demonstrations common sight Sao Paulo other parts country Activists say social conditions countryside far improving significantly deteriorated Pedro leader Movement Landless Rural Workers over months small producers been forced off land Brazil s five southernmost states He exodus been caused first by government s anti inflation Cruzado Plan year froze prices hit income small farmers When Cruzado Plan collapsed late year prices interest rates soared many small farmers were unable to pay debts taken out during price freeze Pedro most families who left countryside south previously been land owners while minority been tenant farmers Most moved to Brazil s swollen cities One activist number landless day labourers called boias frias literally cold meals most whom cut sugar cane increased to Sao Paulo state five years ago attempt to improve lot rural poor land reform movement drawn up radical proposal sending to Constituent Assembly proposal severely limit size maximum permissible holding land rights movement does expect to be voted into constitution Pedro at least pct member assembly composed big land owners He added assembly probably vote on proposal by October rejection be signal large scale land invasions

text.body: The United States responded to apparent escalation Iranian rhetoric continued assurances expanded military force Gulf play purely deterrent role I can only emphasize our role there deterrent we re going to be assuring safety American shipping shipping related to war itself State Department spokesman Charles Redman told reporters He asked Iranian claims United States moving towards brink armed conflict Iran Tehran Radio quoted defence spokesman Ali Akbar Hashemi Rafsanjani telling visiting Nicaraguan delegation yesterday At moment United States moving towards brink armed encounter us We concerned believe U S Presence war make our nation even more serious We determined to stand firm certainly win United States disclosed week beefing up Gulf fleet seven to warships also sending refurbished battleship Missouri to patrol just outside strategic Strait Hormuz entrance to Gulf buildup ties U S Plans to escort Kuwaiti oil tankers been re registered to fly American flag gain naval protection against Iranian attacks Asked Iranian rhetoric White House spokesman Marlin Fitzwater We won t any comment or response to Iranian statements Our position been made clear status events Gulf We want end to war no winners no losers any activities or statements tend to prolong war or increase hostilities helpful or welcome Redman he could independently confirm reports Iran offered to halt attacks on Gulf shipping

text.body: Israel s exports to U S can must double over next five years if mideast nation s goal economic independence to be achieved Gad Yaacobi Israeli minister Economy Communication Speaking before American Israel Chamber Commerce seminar Yaacobi Israeli exports to U S were over billion dlrs or one third Israel s total exports while imports U S were around billion dlrs or roughly one sixth total I am convinced Israel exports to U S can reach five billion dlrs next five years if we learn to function American marketplace place greater emphasis on product quality Yaacobi While weakening dollar vis a vis European currencies bottleneck to increasing exports to U S Yaacobi he expects Israel to extend recent trend toward higher U S exports ten years Israeli exports to U S rose fivefold dlrs to billion while imports rose dlrs to billion year Yaacobi export growth must increase ten to eleven pct annually rate achieved until Yom Kippur War He U S Israel Free Trade agreement passed year eliminating all duties other commercial restrictions between two nations through continue to facilitate desired export growth Dual agreements included FTA allow Israel to act as economic bridge between U S Europe enabling U S firms to export to Europe at lower cost if certain percentage exported produced Israel vice versa Yaacobi tensions among nations middle east one main reasons Israel yet been able to achieve economic potential Since U S given Israel billion dlrs aid but most went to defense expenditures financing military conflicts which were imposed on Israel he Short achieving Israel s full growth potential however Yaccobi still be possible to achieve economic independence by or based on assumption exports can be doubled levels time period
